content.question: Two pulleys of different radii are rigidly attached together at their centers, as shown in the figure. The smaller pulley, of radius <math alttext="0.1 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>, has a lightweight string wrapped around it. A force of <math alttext="10 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> pulls downward on the left section of string, and a force of <math alttext="4 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> pulls downward on the right section of string. The larger pulley, of radius <math alttext="0.2 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>, also has a lightweight string wrapped around it. A single force of <math alttext="4 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> pulls downward on this string. Which of the following gives the correct direction of the two-pulley systemâ€™s angular acceleration, and provides appropriate supporting evidence?

choices.label: Clockwise. The sum of the torques from the two <math alttext="4 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> forces is greater than torque from the <math alttext="10 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> force.

Clockwise. The sum of the lever arms for the two <math alttext="4 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> forces is greater than the lever arm for the <math alttext="10 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> force.

Counterclockwise. The torque from the <math alttext="10 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> force is greater than each of the torques from the <math alttext="4 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> forces.

Counterclockwise. The <math alttext="10 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> force is greater than the sum of the two <math alttext="4 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> forces.

content.answer: Clockwise. The sum of the torques from the two <math alttext="4 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> forces is greater than torque from the <math alttext="10 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> force.
